title: President departs for the United States to attend UN general assembly
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake left the country last night (22) to attend the 80th Session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) in New York.

title: Inflation edges up in August on base effects
byline: The consumer prices, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), climbed 1.5 percent in August from a year earlier, accelerating from July’s 0.7 percent.

title: National Consumer Front urges government to introduce food price controls
byline: The government has completed a year in office but has yet to amend the Consumer Protection Act, National Consumer Front leader Asela Sampath told the Daily Mirror.

title: Sri Lankan Baggage Exposed
byline: Sri Lanka walk into Abu Dhabi on Tuesday with no safety net left. Their Super Four clash against Pakistan is, in every sense, a must-win. Another slip, and their hold on the Asia Cup T20 crown will be gone.

title: Four acting ministers appointed during President’s UN visit
byline: Four Acting Ministers have been appointed to key ministries following the departure of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to the United States to attend the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA).

title: NMRA breaks silence on decade-long delay in cancer treatment machines
byline: The National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) confirmed that a decision has been reached regarding the long-delayed procurement of five Linear Accelerator Radiation Therapy Machines, with an official announcement to be made in due course.

title: Statement by Easter bombing victim’s father to OHCHR will affect Sri Lanka: Sajith
byline: The statement made by the father of Vihanga Tejan, the child who died in the 2019 Easter Sunday explosion at the Shangri-La Hotel, to the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR), will have an adverse impact on Sri Lanka, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa told Parliament today.

title: Functions of private maritime security companies handed over to Navy
byline: The functions of private companies providing maritime security have been handed over to the Sri Lankan Navy by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne announced in Parliament today.

title: Just not cricket: how India-Pakistan tensions spill onto the pitch
byline: India and Pakistan’s refusal to shake hands during their Asia Cup cricket matches bent the code of the so-called ’’gentleman’s game’’, as sport once again served as a proxy battlefield.

title: Hong Kong braces for travel chaos as super typhoon approaches
byline: Hong Kong has shut schools and some businesses, while the airport will ground most flights from Tuesday evening as the city braces for a super typhoon - the strongest storm of the year so far.

title: Non-Smoking Sri Lanka in future?
byline: Sri Lanka is presently heading towards a ‘no-smokers’ zone’ due to the youngsters aged 15-25 staying away from the habit, an official from the Alcohol and Drug Information Centre (ADIC) said.

title: Leave of CEB employees cancelled until further notice
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has cancelled the leave of all its employees with immediate effect until further notice, according to a written directive issued by the General Manager.

title: Three Pakistanis arrested for robbing driver using chemical-laced currency note in Peradeniya
byline: In what appeared to be a rare tactic employed in robberies, three Pakistani nationals have been arrested for allegedly robbing a lorry driver of Rs.90,000 after rendering him unconscious using a chemical-laced Rs. 5,000 currency note.

title: Restructuring of CEB in disarray: Opposition MP
byline: Opposition MP Dayasiri Jayasekara yesterday criticised the ongoing restructuring of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), describing the process as being in disarray and raising concerns over the welfare of its employees.

title: Ousmane Dembélé wins 2025 Men’s Ballon d’Or
byline: Ousmane Dembélé has been awarded the 2025 Men’s Ballon d’Or, with other honours going to Lamine Yamal, Luis Enrique, Viktor Gyökeres and Gianluigi Donnarumma.

title: Government begins unbundling of CEB
byline: The government has initiated the unbundling of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) into four state-owned companies, with the attachment of employees to the new entities already underway, the Ministry of Power and Energy announced yesterday.

title: CEB unions reject gazette, continue trade union action over consumer rights: CEWU
byline: CEB unions reject gazette, continue trade union action over consumer rights: Ceylon Electricity Workers’ Union

title: Veteran actor Nalin Pradeep Udawela passes away
byline: Veteran actor Nalin Pradeep Udawela has passed away, family sources confirmed today.

title: Singapore firm rejects $1 billion Sri Lankan pollution damages
byline: A Singapore shipping company told AFP on Tuesday it will refuse to pay Sri Lankan court-ordered damages of US$1 billion for causing that country’s worst case of environmental pollution.

title: France formally recognises Palestinian state
byline: France has formally recognised a Palestinian state, becoming the latest in a wave of countries to take the step.

title: President departs for the United States to attend UN general assembly
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake left the country last night (22) to attend the 80th Session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) in New York.

title: Typhoon Ragasa heads to Taiwan, Hong Kong, China after lashing Philippines
byline: A super typhoon that caused thousands of people to evacuate from northern Philippine villages and left at least three people dead is now making its way towards Hong Kong, the southern parts of mainland China, and Taiwan, where people are preparing for more extreme weather.

title: Massive drug haul in Tangalle: Two arrested
byline: Police have arrested two sons of a man who died after being admitted to hospital from a house in Seenimodara, Tangalle, where a massive stock of narcotics was discovered yesterday (22).

title: UN raises alarm over X-Press Pearl compensation refusal
byline: The United Nations Office in Sri Lanka has expressed concern over Singapore-based shipping company X-Press Feeders’ refusal to comply with a Supreme Court order to pay US$1 billion in compensation for the X-Press Pearl maritime disaster.

title: Why Spain’s Bonmati won record third women’s Ballon d’Or
byline: Spain and Barcelona midfielder Aitana Bonmati has made history by becoming the first player to win the women’s Ballon d’Or three times.

title: Minister Handunnetti refuses to answer questions on assets during TV interview
byline: Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunnetti has said it is “not wise” to question him about his assets during a live television programme.

title: Former Moratuwa Mayor Samanlal released on bail
byline: Former Moratuwa Mayor Samanlal Fernando was released on bail by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today.

title: Harsha Ilukpitiya jailed for two years
byline: Former Controller General of Immigration and Emigration Harsha Ilukpitiya was today sentenced to two years imprisonment by the Supreme Court over the contempt of court charges filed against him over the controversial visa deal.

title: Sri Lanka’s Flaws Laid Bare as Losses Trigger Shake-Up
byline: Sri Lanka walk into Abu Dhabi on Tuesday with no safety net left. Their Super Four clash against Pakistan is, in every sense, a must-win. Another slip, and their hold on the Asia Cup T20 crown will be gone.

title: Afghan boy flies from Kabul to Delhi hiding in plane’s landing gear
byline: A 13-year-old Afghan boy made a dangerous journey from Kabul to Delhi, hiding in the landing gear compartment of a Kam Air passenger plane.

title: President’s first year sees Rs. 17–39 fuel price cut
byline: Fuel prices have dropped between Rs. 17 and Rs. 39 during the first year of the current President’s tenure, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: ’’You are talking like an idiot’’ – Archuna clashes with Police again
byline: MP Ramanathan Archuna clashed with police after being asked to remove his car, which was reportedly parked illegally near Fort Railway Station.

title: Govt. committed to ensuring uninterrupted power supply: Cabinet Spokesperson
byline: Cabinet Spokesperson and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa today said that it is the responsibility of the government to ensure a continuous supply of electricity and that it is not prepared to allow a power outage.

title: New Zealand loosens path to residency for some migrants
byline: The New Zealand government said on Tuesday it was introducing two new pathways for migrants to gain residency as part of their efforts to boost the country’s economy.

title: New digital platform to access Government services
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to develop a ‘Government SuperApp’ aimed at providing citizens with seamless access to government services through a single digital platform.

title: Cabinet nod to renovate state universities
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to renovate several state universities by completing the construction of university buildings and other related infrastructure facilities.

title: Tusker ‘Sapumal’ shot and injured
byline: The tusker known as ‘Sapumal’, a well-known resident of the Hurulu Eco Park and Minneriya National Park, has reportedly been shot by unidentified individuals.

title: Handunnetti refuses to answer questions on assets during TV interview
byline: Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunnetti has said it is “not wise” to question him about his assets during a live television programme.
